page.title: 13FRIDAYWOODS
page.content: {FRIDAYWOODS _}This is a popular recreation area for local people. It was once the forest of St.Johns Abbey and is probably the only piece of original forest left around Colchester. It is an area of outstanding natural history archaeology and amenity value. Flora and Fauna abound. Early morning in spring the song of the Nightingales can be deafening. Over 200 species of butterfly including the rare Essex Skipper have been recorded. {CHARLOTTE'S GROVE _ }planted in the 19th century by Sir George Smythe,then owner of Berechurch Hall,in memory of his only daughter, Lady Charlotte who died at the age of 33. There are many local legends about the lady and her haunted grotto behind Lethe Grove.
